title: Modelling the transcriptional proteomic and metabolic redox regulation in Saccharomyces cerevisiae and Candida glabrata
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText:
This grant provided exchange between the UK and Japan. Professor Haynes visited Japan at the start of the grant and this was broadcast on national news. There have been six exchanges between Keio University and University of Exeter.

We have published one Other Societal
findingsText: We investigated the cycling of redox states in the pathogenic fungus Candida glabrata. We observed that as in the model yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae there is a redox cycle in C. glabrata. This underpins the "health" of the cell, and at  Agriculture, Food and Drink,Environment,Healthcare,Other
